resources.string:
This app based on ScienceGlass blog website (https://cosmos.home.blog)

Any new posts on the official blog is automatically shown here as well.
To see how this app works scroll down this page and read about list of all features available

To temporarily remove a post from the list posts:
Swipe the post card left or right
To restore posts: click on Refresh button.

To swap a post to some other place in list:
Tap and Hold on the post and swipe it up or down. The position of the post will change
To restore posts to their original position: click on Refresh button

To set number of recent posts you want to see in the app:
Go to Settings->Tap on Post count

Note: If you set the postcount value more than total number of posts, you will see maximum no of posts instead of postcount value

Navigation menu has a list of additional features and links users can access.
To access navigation menu: Tap on top left or swipe from left side of the screen

Website: Redirects users to the official website on which the app is based on. https:cosmos.home.blog

About: Information on what is ScienceGlass blog is all about

Suggestion: Users can submit their suggestion for improvement of this app or main blog website. On clicking submit, users are redirected to their email.

Facebook Page: Redirects to the official facebook page of ScienceGlass.

Contact Author: Redirects to social media account of the author of ScienceGlass

Refresh button is an orange circular button situated at bottom right corner of the main screen.

Tap on Refresh button to get a refreshed list of posts

Refresh button will also restore swapping and swiping (deleting) of all posts back to their original position

To change layout of posts list (the way posts are shown on screen):
Tap on ChangeLayout

Two layouts are available: Gridlayout and LinearLayout. When you close the app and restart, the app remembers which layout you prefer

Default layout when app is first installed: LinearLayout

Knowledge and Imagination are two crucial things that have the most impact on the modern world.

In this blog, I talk about Scientific facts about our world, that at times are often mysterious, weird and strange but true. You will find a list of articles that are related to mysterious scientific facts, scientific phenomenon, space, time, self-development, self-improvement, strange and interesting mysteries about our life, mysteries on the internet, case studies, psychology and almost anything else related to science. 

If you have got any suggestions/opinions/critics for this blog or any of my blog posts or if you want to contribute as an author for one of my post. Sign up at the “Contact” page and you will get the response in the next 24 hours. You can also put a comment down in the comment section of posts too
